<!-- ======== START OF CLASS DATA ======== -->
<main role="main">
<div class="header">
<div class="subTitle"><span class="moduleLabelInType">Module</span>&nbsp;<a href="../../module-summary.html">java.base</a></div>
<div class="subTitle"><span class="packageLabelInType">Package</span>&nbsp;<a href="package-summary.html">java.time</a></div>
<h2 title="Class OffsetDateTime" class="title">Class OffsetDateTime</h2>
</div>
<div class="contentContainer">
<ul class="inheritance">
<li><a href="../lang/Object.html" title="class in java.lang">java.lang.Object</a></li>
<li>
<ul class="inheritance">
<li>java.time.OffsetDateTime</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<div class="description">
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<dl>
<dt>All Implemented Interfaces:</dt>
<dd><code><a href="../io/Serializable.html" title="interface in java.io">Serializable</a></code>, <code><a href="../lang/Comparable.html" title="interface in java.lang">Comparable</a>&lt;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&gt;</code>, <code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">Temporal</a></code>, <code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAccessor</a></code>, <code><a href="temporal/TemporalAdjuster.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAdjuster</a></code></dd>
</dl>
<hr>
<pre>public final class <span class="typeNameLabel">OffsetDateTime</span>
extends <a href="../lang/Object.html" title="class in java.lang">Object</a>
implements <a href="temporal/Temporal.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">Temporal</a>, <a href="temporal/TemporalAdjuster.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAdjuster</a>, <a href="../lang/Comparable.html" title="interface in java.lang">Comparable</a>&lt;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&gt;, <a href="../io/Serializable.html" title="interface in java.io">Serializable</a></pre>
<div class="block">A date-time with an offset from UTC/Greenwich in the ISO-8601 calendar system,
 such as <code>2007-12-03T10:15:30+01:00</code>.
 <p>
 <code>OffsetDateTime</code> is an immutable representation of a date-time with an offset.
 This class stores all date and time fields, to a precision of nanoseconds,
 as well as the offset from UTC/Greenwich. For example, the value
 "2nd October 2007 at 13:45:30.123456789 +02:00" can be stored in an <code>OffsetDateTime</code>.
 </p><p>
 <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, <a href="ZonedDateTime.html" title="class in java.time"><code>ZonedDateTime</code></a> and <a href="Instant.html" title="class in java.time"><code>Instant</code></a> all store an instant
 on the time-line to nanosecond precision.
 <code>Instant</code> is the simplest, simply representing the instant.
 <code>OffsetDateTime</code> adds to the instant the offset from UTC/Greenwich, which allows
 the local date-time to be obtained.
 <code>ZonedDateTime</code> adds full time-zone rules.
 </p><p>
 It is intended that <code>ZonedDateTime</code> or <code>Instant</code> is used to model data
 in simpler applications. This class may be used when modeling date-time concepts in
 more detail, or when communicating to a database or in a network protocol.

 </p><p>
 This is a <a href="../../../java.base/java/lang/doc-files/ValueBased.html">value-based</a>
 class; use of identity-sensitive operations (including reference equality
 (<code>==</code>), identity hash code, or synchronization) on instances of
 <code>OffsetDateTime</code> may have unpredictable results and should be avoided.
 The <code>equals</code> method should be used for comparisons.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="simpleTagLabel">Implementation Requirements:</span></dt>
<dd>This class is immutable and thread-safe.</dd>
<dt><span class="simpleTagLabel">Since:</span></dt>
<dd>1.8</dd>
<dt><span class="seeLabel">See Also:</span></dt>
<dd><a href="../../../serialized-form.html#java.time.OffsetDateTime">Serialized Form</a></dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="summary">
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">

<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#MAX">MAX</a></span></code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">The maximum supported <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, '+999999999-12-31T23:59:59.999999999-18:00'.</div>
</td>
</tr>

<td class="colFirst"><code>static <a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#MIN">MIN</a></span></code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">The minimum supported <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, '-999999999-01-01T00:00:00+18:00'.</div>
</td>

<div class="block">Gets the zone offset, such as '+01:00'.</div>
</td>
</tr>

<td class="colLast">

<tr id="i67" class="rowColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code>long</code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#until(java.time.temporal.Temporal,java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)">until</a></span>&#8203;(<a href="temporal/Temporal.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">Temporal</a>&nbsp;endExclusive,
     <a href="temporal/TemporalUnit.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalUnit</a>&nbsp;unit)</code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Calculates the amount of time until another date-time in terms of the specified unit.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr id="i68" class="altColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code><a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#with(java.time.temporal.TemporalAdjuster)">with</a></span>&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalAdjuster.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAdjuster</a>&nbsp;adjuster)</code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns an adjusted copy of this date-time.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr id="i69" class="rowColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code><a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#with(java.time.temporal.TemporalField,long)">with</a></span>&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalField.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalField</a>&nbsp;field,
    long&nbsp;newValue)</code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this date-time with the specified field set to a new value.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr id="i70" class="altColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code><a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#withDayOfMonth(int)">withDayOfMonth</a></span>&#8203;(int&nbsp;dayOfMonth)</code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the day-of-month altered.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr id="i71" class="rowColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code><a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#withDayOfYear(int)">withDayOfYear</a></span>&#8203;(int&nbsp;dayOfYear)</code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the day-of-year altered.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr id="i72" class="altColor">

<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the hour-of-day altered.</div>

<tr id="i73" class="rowColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code><a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>

<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the minute-of-hour altered.</div>

<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the month-of-year altered.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr id="i75" class="rowColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code><a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#withNano(int)">withNano</a></span>&#8203;(int&nbsp;nanoOfSecond)</code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the nano-of-second altered.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr id="i76" class="altColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code><a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#withOffsetSameInstant(java.time.ZoneOffset)">withOffsetSameInstant</a></span>&#8203;(<a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneOffset</a>&nbsp;offset)</code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the specified offset ensuring
 that the result is at the same instant.</div>
</td>
</tr>
<tr id="i77" class="rowColor">
<td class="colFirst"><code><a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a></code></td>
<th class="colSecond" scope="row"><code><span class="memberNameLink"><a href="#withOffsetSameLocal(java.time.ZoneOffset)">withOffsetSameLocal</a></span>&#8203;(<a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneOffset</a>&nbsp;offset)</code></th>
<td class="colLast">
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the specified offset ensuring
 that the result has the same local date-time.</div>
</td>
</tr>

<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList"><a id="methods.inherited.from.class.java.lang.Object">
<!--   -->
</a>
<h3>Methods declared in class&nbsp;java.lang.<a href="../lang/Object.html" title="class in java.lang">Object</a></h3>
<code><a href="../lang/Object.html#clone()">clone</a>, <a href="../lang/Object.html#finalize()">finalize</a>, <a href="../lang/Object.html#getClass()">getClass</a>, <a href="../lang/Object.html#notify()">notify</a>, <a href="../lang/Object.html#notifyAll()">notifyAll</a>, <a href="../lang/Object.html#wait()">wait</a>, <a href="../lang/Object.html#wait(long)">wait</a>, <a href="../lang/Object.html#wait(long,int)">wait</a></code></li>

</li>
</ul>
</section>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="details">
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<!-- ============ FIELD DETAIL =========== -->
<section>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList"><a id="field.detail">
<!--   -->
</a>
<h3>Field Detail</h3>
<a id="MIN">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>MIN</h4>
<pre>public static final&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a> MIN</pre>
<div class="block">The minimum supported <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, '-999999999-01-01T00:00:00+18:00'.
 This is the local date-time of midnight at the start of the minimum date
 in the maximum offset (larger offsets are earlier on the time-line).
 This combines <a href="LocalDateTime.html#MIN"><code>LocalDateTime.MIN</code></a> and <a href="ZoneOffset.html#MAX"><code>ZoneOffset.MAX</code></a>.
 This could be used by an application as a "far past" date-time.</div>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="MAX">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockListLast">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>MAX</h4>
<pre>public static final&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a> MAX</pre>
<div class="block">The maximum supported <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, '+999999999-12-31T23:59:59.999999999-18:00'.
 This is the local date-time just before midnight at the end of the maximum date
 in the minimum offset (larger negative offsets are later on the time-line).
 This combines <a href="LocalDateTime.html#MAX"><code>LocalDateTime.MAX</code></a> and <a href="ZoneOffset.html#MIN"><code>ZoneOffset.MIN</code></a>.
 This could be used by an application as a "far future" date-time.</div>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</section>
<!-- ============ METHOD DETAIL ========== -->
<section>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList"><a id="method.detail">
<!--   -->
</a>
<h3>Method Detail</h3>
<a id="timeLineOrder()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>timeLineOrder</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="../util/Comparator.html" title="interface in java.util">Comparator</a>&lt;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&gt;&nbsp;timeLineOrder()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets a comparator that compares two <code>OffsetDateTime</code> instances
 based solely on the instant.
 <p>
 This method differs from the comparison in <a href="#compareTo(java.time.OffsetDateTime)"><code>compareTo(java.time.OffsetDateTime)</code></a> in that it
 only compares the underlying instant.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>a comparator that compares in time-line order</dd>
<dt><span class="seeLabel">See Also:</span></dt>
<dd><a href="#isAfter(java.time.OffsetDateTime)"><code>isAfter(java.time.OffsetDateTime)</code></a>, 
<a href="#isBefore(java.time.OffsetDateTime)"><code>isBefore(java.time.OffsetDateTime)</code></a>, 
<a href="#isEqual(java.time.OffsetDateTime)"><code>isEqual(java.time.OffsetDateTime)</code></a></dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="now()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>now</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;now()</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains the current date-time from the system clock in the default time-zone.
 <p>
 This will query the <a href="Clock.html#systemDefaultZone()"><code>system clock</code></a> in the default
 time-zone to obtain the current date-time.
 The offset will be calculated from the time-zone in the clock.
 </p><p>
 Using this method will prevent the ability to use an alternate clock for testing
 because the clock is hard-coded.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the current date-time using the system clock, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="now(java.time.ZoneId)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>now</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;now&#8203;(<a href="ZoneId.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneId</a>&nbsp;zone)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains the current date-time from the system clock in the specified time-zone.
 <p>
 This will query the <a href="Clock.html#system(java.time.ZoneId)"><code>system clock</code></a> to obtain the current date-time.
 Specifying the time-zone avoids dependence on the default time-zone.
 The offset will be calculated from the specified time-zone.
 </p><p>
 Using this method will prevent the ability to use an alternate clock for testing
 because the clock is hard-coded.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>zone</code> - the zone ID to use, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the current date-time using the system clock, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="now(java.time.Clock)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>now</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;now&#8203;(<a href="Clock.html" title="class in java.time">Clock</a>&nbsp;clock)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains the current date-time from the specified clock.
 <p>
 This will query the specified clock to obtain the current date-time.
 The offset will be calculated from the time-zone in the clock.
 </p><p>
 Using this method allows the use of an alternate clock for testing.
 The alternate clock may be introduced using <a href="Clock.html" title="class in java.time"><code>dependency injection</code></a>.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>clock</code> - the clock to use, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the current date-time, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="of(java.time.LocalDate,java.time.LocalTime,java.time.ZoneOffset)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>of</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;of&#8203;(<a href="LocalDate.html" title="class in java.time">LocalDate</a>&nbsp;date,
                                <a href="LocalTime.html" title="class in java.time">LocalTime</a>&nbsp;time,
                                <a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneOffset</a>&nbsp;offset)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains an instance of <code>OffsetDateTime</code> from a date, time and offset.
 <p>
 This creates an offset date-time with the specified local date, time and offset.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>date</code> - the local date, not null</dd>
<dd><code>time</code> - the local time, not null</dd>
<dd><code>offset</code> - the zone offset, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the offset date-time, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="of(java.time.LocalDateTime,java.time.ZoneOffset)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>of</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;of&#8203;(<a href="LocalDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">LocalDateTime</a>&nbsp;dateTime,
                                <a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneOffset</a>&nbsp;offset)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains an instance of <code>OffsetDateTime</code> from a date-time and offset.
 <p>
 This creates an offset date-time with the specified local date-time and offset.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>dateTime</code> - the local date-time, not null</dd>
<dd><code>offset</code> - the zone offset, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the offset date-time, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="of(int,int,int,int,int,int,int,java.time.ZoneOffset)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>of</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;of&#8203;(int&nbsp;year,
                                int&nbsp;month,
                                int&nbsp;dayOfMonth,
                                int&nbsp;hour,
                                int&nbsp;minute,
                                int&nbsp;second,
                                int&nbsp;nanoOfSecond,
                                <a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneOffset</a>&nbsp;offset)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains an instance of <code>OffsetDateTime</code> from a year, month, day,
 hour, minute, second, nanosecond and offset.
 <p>
 This creates an offset date-time with the seven specified fields.
 </p><p>
 This method exists primarily for writing test cases.
 Non test-code will typically use other methods to create an offset time.
 <code>LocalDateTime</code> has five additional convenience variants of the
 equivalent factory method taking fewer arguments.
 They are not provided here to reduce the footprint of the API.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>year</code> - the year to represent, from MIN_YEAR to MAX_YEAR</dd>
<dd><code>month</code> - the month-of-year to represent, from 1 (January) to 12 (December)</dd>
<dd><code>dayOfMonth</code> - the day-of-month to represent, from 1 to 31</dd>
<dd><code>hour</code> - the hour-of-day to represent, from 0 to 23</dd>
<dd><code>minute</code> - the minute-of-hour to represent, from 0 to 59</dd>
<dd><code>second</code> - the second-of-minute to represent, from 0 to 59</dd>
<dd><code>nanoOfSecond</code> - the nano-of-second to represent, from 0 to 999,999,999</dd>
<dd><code>offset</code> - the zone offset, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the offset date-time, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the value of any field is out of range, or
  if the day-of-month is invalid for the month-year</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="ofInstant(java.time.Instant,java.time.ZoneId)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>ofInstant</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;ofInstant&#8203;(<a href="Instant.html" title="class in java.time">Instant</a>&nbsp;instant,
                                       <a href="ZoneId.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneId</a>&nbsp;zone)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains an instance of <code>OffsetDateTime</code> from an <code>Instant</code> and zone ID.
 <p>
 This creates an offset date-time with the same instant as that specified.
 Finding the offset from UTC/Greenwich is simple as there is only one valid
 offset for each instant.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>instant</code> - the instant to create the date-time from, not null</dd>
<dd><code>zone</code> - the time-zone, which may be an offset, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the offset date-time, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the result exceeds the supported range</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="from(java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>from</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;from&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAccessor</a>&nbsp;temporal)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains an instance of <code>OffsetDateTime</code> from a temporal object.
 <p>
 This obtains an offset date-time based on the specified temporal.
 A <code>TemporalAccessor</code> represents an arbitrary set of date and time information,
 which this factory converts to an instance of <code>OffsetDateTime</code>.
 </p><p>
 The conversion will first obtain a <code>ZoneOffset</code> from the temporal object.
 It will then try to obtain a <code>LocalDateTime</code>, falling back to an <code>Instant</code> if necessary.
 The result will be the combination of <code>ZoneOffset</code> with either
 with <code>LocalDateTime</code> or <code>Instant</code>.
 Implementations are permitted to perform optimizations such as accessing
 those fields that are equivalent to the relevant objects.
 </p><p>
 This method matches the signature of the functional interface <a href="temporal/TemporalQuery.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal"><code>TemporalQuery</code></a>
 allowing it to be used as a query via method reference, <code>OffsetDateTime::from</code>.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>temporal</code> - the temporal object to convert, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the offset date-time, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if unable to convert to an <code>OffsetDateTime</code></dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="parse(java.lang.CharSequence)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>parse</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;parse&#8203;(<a href="../lang/CharSequence.html" title="interface in java.lang">CharSequence</a>&nbsp;text)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains an instance of <code>OffsetDateTime</code> from a text string
 such as <code>2007-12-03T10:15:30+01:00</code>.
 <p>
 The string must represent a valid date-time and is parsed using
 <a href="format/DateTimeFormatter.html#ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME"><code>DateTimeFormatter.ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME</code></a>.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>text</code> - the text to parse such as "2007-12-03T10:15:30+01:00", not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the parsed offset date-time, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="format/DateTimeParseException.html" title="class in java.time.format">DateTimeParseException</a></code> - if the text cannot be parsed</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="parse(java.lang.CharSequence,java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>parse</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public static&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;parse&#8203;(<a href="../lang/CharSequence.html" title="interface in java.lang">CharSequence</a>&nbsp;text,
                                   <a href="format/DateTimeFormatter.html" title="class in java.time.format">DateTimeFormatter</a>&nbsp;formatter)</pre>
<div class="block">Obtains an instance of <code>OffsetDateTime</code> from a text string using a specific formatter.
 <p>
 The text is parsed using the formatter, returning a date-time.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>text</code> - the text to parse, not null</dd>
<dd><code>formatter</code> - the formatter to use, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the parsed offset date-time, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="format/DateTimeParseException.html" title="class in java.time.format">DateTimeParseException</a></code> - if the text cannot be parsed</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="isSupported(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>isSupported</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;boolean&nbsp;isSupported&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalField.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalField</a>&nbsp;field)</pre>
<div class="block">Checks if the specified field is supported.
 <p>
 This checks if this date-time can be queried for the specified field.
 If false, then calling the <a href="#range(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)"><code>range</code></a>,
 <a href="#get(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)"><code>get</code></a> and <a href="#with(java.time.temporal.TemporalField,long)"><code>with(TemporalField, long)</code></a>
 methods will throw an exception.
 </p><p>
 If the field is a <a href="temporal/ChronoField.html" title="enum in java.time.temporal"><code>ChronoField</code></a> then the query is implemented here.
 The supported fields are:
 <ul>
 <li><code>NANO_OF_SECOND</code>
 </li><li><code>NANO_OF_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>MICRO_OF_SECOND</code>
 </li><li><code>MICRO_OF_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>MILLI_OF_SECOND</code>
 </li><li><code>MILLI_OF_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>SECOND_OF_MINUTE</code>
 </li><li><code>SECOND_OF_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>MINUTE_OF_HOUR</code>
 </li><li><code>MINUTE_OF_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>HOUR_OF_AMPM</code>
 </li><li><code>CLOCK_HOUR_OF_AMPM</code>
 </li><li><code>HOUR_OF_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>CLOCK_HOUR_OF_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>AMPM_OF_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>DAY_OF_WEEK</code>
 </li><li><code>ALIGNED_DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_MONTH</code>
 </li><li><code>ALIGNED_DAY_OF_WEEK_IN_YEAR</code>
 </li><li><code>DAY_OF_MONTH</code>
 </li><li><code>DAY_OF_YEAR</code>
 </li><li><code>EPOCH_DAY</code>
 </li><li><code>ALIGNED_WEEK_OF_MONTH</code>
 </li><li><code>ALIGNED_WEEK_OF_YEAR</code>
 </li><li><code>MONTH_OF_YEAR</code>
 </li><li><code>PROLEPTIC_MONTH</code>
 </li><li><code>YEAR_OF_ERA</code>
 </li><li><code>YEAR</code>
 </li><li><code>ERA</code>
 </li><li><code>INSTANT_SECONDS</code>
 </li><li><code>OFFSET_SECONDS</code>
 </li></ul>
 All other <code>ChronoField</code> instances will return false.
 </p><p>
 If the field is not a <code>ChronoField</code>, then the result of this method
 is obtained by invoking <code>TemporalField.isSupportedBy(TemporalAccessor)</code>
 passing <code>this</code> as the argument.
 Whether the field is supported is determined by the field.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html#isSupported(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)">isSupported</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAccessor</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>field</code> - the field to check, null returns false</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>true if the field is supported on this date-time, false if not</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="isSupported(java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>isSupported</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;boolean&nbsp;isSupported&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalUnit.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalUnit</a>&nbsp;unit)</pre>
<div class="block">Checks if the specified unit is supported.
 <p>
 This checks if the specified unit can be added to, or subtracted from, this date-time.
 If false, then calling the <a href="#plus(long,java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)"><code>plus(long, TemporalUnit)</code></a> and
 <a href="#minus(long,java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)"><code>minus</code></a> methods will throw an exception.
 </p><p>
 If the unit is a <a href="temporal/ChronoUnit.html" title="enum in java.time.temporal"><code>ChronoUnit</code></a> then the query is implemented here.
 The supported units are:
 <ul>
 <li><code>NANOS</code>
 </li><li><code>MICROS</code>
 </li><li><code>MILLIS</code>
 </li><li><code>SECONDS</code>
 </li><li><code>MINUTES</code>
 </li><li><code>HOURS</code>
 </li><li><code>HALF_DAYS</code>
 </li><li><code>DAYS</code>
 </li><li><code>WEEKS</code>
 </li><li><code>MONTHS</code>
 </li><li><code>YEARS</code>
 </li><li><code>DECADES</code>
 </li><li><code>CENTURIES</code>
 </li><li><code>MILLENNIA</code>
 </li><li><code>ERAS</code>
 </li></ul>
 All other <code>ChronoUnit</code> instances will return false.
 </p><p>
 If the unit is not a <code>ChronoUnit</code>, then the result of this method
 is obtained by invoking <code>TemporalUnit.isSupportedBy(Temporal)</code>
 passing <code>this</code> as the argument.
 Whether the unit is supported is determined by the unit.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html#isSupported(java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)">isSupported</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">Temporal</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>unit</code> - the unit to check, null returns false</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>true if the unit can be added/subtracted, false if not</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="range(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>range</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="temporal/ValueRange.html" title="class in java.time.temporal">ValueRange</a>&nbsp;range&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalField.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalField</a>&nbsp;field)</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the range of valid values for the specified field.
 <p>
 The range object expresses the minimum and maximum valid values for a field.
 This date-time is used to enhance the accuracy of the returned range.
 If it is not possible to return the range, because the field is not supported
 or for some other reason, an exception is thrown.
 </p><p>
 If the field is a <a href="temporal/ChronoField.html" title="enum in java.time.temporal"><code>ChronoField</code></a> then the query is implemented here.
 The <a href="#isSupported(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)"><code>supported fields</code></a> will return
 appropriate range instances.
 All other <code>ChronoField</code> instances will throw an <code>UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</code>.
 </p><p>
 If the field is not a <code>ChronoField</code>, then the result of this method
 is obtained by invoking <code>TemporalField.rangeRefinedBy(TemporalAccessor)</code>
 passing <code>this</code> as the argument.
 Whether the range can be obtained is determined by the field.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html#range(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)">range</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAccessor</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>field</code> - the field to query the range for, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the range of valid values for the field, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the range for the field cannot be obtained</dd>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/UnsupportedTemporalTypeException.html" title="class in java.time.temporal">UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</a></code> - if the field is not supported</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="get(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>get</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;get&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalField.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalField</a>&nbsp;field)</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the value of the specified field from this date-time as an <code>int</code>.
 <p>
 This queries this date-time for the value of the specified field.
 The returned value will always be within the valid range of values for the field.
 If it is not possible to return the value, because the field is not supported
 or for some other reason, an exception is thrown.
 </p><p>
 If the field is a <a href="temporal/ChronoField.html" title="enum in java.time.temporal"><code>ChronoField</code></a> then the query is implemented here.
 The <a href="#isSupported(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)"><code>supported fields</code></a> will return valid
 values based on this date-time, except <code>NANO_OF_DAY</code>, <code>MICRO_OF_DAY</code>,
 <code>EPOCH_DAY</code>, <code>PROLEPTIC_MONTH</code> and <code>INSTANT_SECONDS</code> which are too
 large to fit in an <code>int</code> and throw an <code>UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</code>.
 All other <code>ChronoField</code> instances will throw an <code>UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</code>.
 </p><p>
 If the field is not a <code>ChronoField</code>, then the result of this method
 is obtained by invoking <code>TemporalField.getFrom(TemporalAccessor)</code>
 passing <code>this</code> as the argument. Whether the value can be obtained,
 and what the value represents, is determined by the field.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html#get(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)">get</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAccessor</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>field</code> - the field to get, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the value for the field</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if a value for the field cannot be obtained or
         the value is outside the range of valid values for the field</dd>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/UnsupportedTemporalTypeException.html" title="class in java.time.temporal">UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</a></code> - if the field is not supported or
         the range of values exceeds an <code>int</code></dd>
<dd><code><a href="../lang/ArithmeticException.html" title="class in java.lang">ArithmeticException</a></code> - if numeric overflow occurs</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getLong(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getLong</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;long&nbsp;getLong&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalField.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalField</a>&nbsp;field)</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the value of the specified field from this date-time as a <code>long</code>.
 <p>
 This queries this date-time for the value of the specified field.
 If it is not possible to return the value, because the field is not supported
 or for some other reason, an exception is thrown.
 </p><p>
 If the field is a <a href="temporal/ChronoField.html" title="enum in java.time.temporal"><code>ChronoField</code></a> then the query is implemented here.
 The <a href="#isSupported(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)"><code>supported fields</code></a> will return valid
 values based on this date-time.
 All other <code>ChronoField</code> instances will throw an <code>UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</code>.
 </p><p>
 If the field is not a <code>ChronoField</code>, then the result of this method
 is obtained by invoking <code>TemporalField.getFrom(TemporalAccessor)</code>
 passing <code>this</code> as the argument. Whether the value can be obtained,
 and what the value represents, is determined by the field.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html#getLong(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)">getLong</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/TemporalAccessor.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAccessor</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>field</code> - the field to get, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the value for the field</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if a value for the field cannot be obtained</dd>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/UnsupportedTemporalTypeException.html" title="class in java.time.temporal">UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</a></code> - if the field is not supported</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../lang/ArithmeticException.html" title="class in java.lang">ArithmeticException</a></code> - if numeric overflow occurs</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getOffset()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getOffset</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneOffset</a>&nbsp;getOffset()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the zone offset, such as '+01:00'.
 <p>
 This is the offset of the local date-time from UTC/Greenwich.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the zone offset, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="withOffsetSameLocal(java.time.ZoneOffset)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withOffsetSameLocal</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withOffsetSameLocal&#8203;(<a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneOffset</a>&nbsp;offset)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the specified offset ensuring
 that the result has the same local date-time.
 <p>
 This method returns an object with the same <code>LocalDateTime</code> and the specified <code>ZoneOffset</code>.
 No calculation is needed or performed.
 For example, if this time represents <code>2007-12-03T10:30+02:00</code> and the offset specified is
 <code>+03:00</code>, then this method will return <code>2007-12-03T10:30+03:00</code>.
 </p><p>
 To take into account the difference between the offsets, and adjust the time fields,
 use <a href="#withOffsetSameInstant(java.time.ZoneOffset)"><code>withOffsetSameInstant(java.time.ZoneOffset)</code></a>.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>offset</code> - the zone offset to change to, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the requested offset, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="withOffsetSameInstant(java.time.ZoneOffset)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withOffsetSameInstant</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withOffsetSameInstant&#8203;(<a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time">ZoneOffset</a>&nbsp;offset)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the specified offset ensuring
 that the result is at the same instant.
 <p>
 This method returns an object with the specified <code>ZoneOffset</code> and a <code>LocalDateTime</code>
 adjusted by the difference between the two offsets.
 This will result in the old and new objects representing the same instant.
 This is useful for finding the local time in a different offset.
 For example, if this time represents <code>2007-12-03T10:30+02:00</code> and the offset specified is
 <code>+03:00</code>, then this method will return <code>2007-12-03T11:30+03:00</code>.
 </p><p>
 To change the offset without adjusting the local time use <a href="#withOffsetSameLocal(java.time.ZoneOffset)"><code>withOffsetSameLocal(java.time.ZoneOffset)</code></a>.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>offset</code> - the zone offset to change to, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the requested offset, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the result exceeds the supported date range</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="toLocalDateTime()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>toLocalDateTime</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="LocalDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">LocalDateTime</a>&nbsp;toLocalDateTime()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the <code>LocalDateTime</code> part of this date-time.
 <p>
 This returns a <code>LocalDateTime</code> with the same year, month, day and time
 as this date-time.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the local date-time part of this date-time, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="toLocalDate()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>toLocalDate</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="LocalDate.html" title="class in java.time">LocalDate</a>&nbsp;toLocalDate()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the <code>LocalDate</code> part of this date-time.
 <p>
 This returns a <code>LocalDate</code> with the same year, month and day
 as this date-time.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the date part of this date-time, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getYear()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getYear</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;getYear()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the year field.
 <p>
 This method returns the primitive <code>int</code> value for the year.
 </p><p>
 The year returned by this method is proleptic as per <code>get(YEAR)</code>.
 To obtain the year-of-era, use <code>get(YEAR_OF_ERA)</code>.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the year, from MIN_YEAR to MAX_YEAR</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getMonthValue()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getMonthValue</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;getMonthValue()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the month-of-year field from 1 to 12.
 <p>
 This method returns the month as an <code>int</code> from 1 to 12.
 Application code is frequently clearer if the enum <a href="Month.html" title="enum in java.time"><code>Month</code></a>
 is used by calling <a href="#getMonth()"><code>getMonth()</code></a>.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the month-of-year, from 1 to 12</dd>
<dt><span class="seeLabel">See Also:</span></dt>
<dd><a href="#getMonth()"><code>getMonth()</code></a></dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getMonth()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getMonth</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="Month.html" title="enum in java.time">Month</a>&nbsp;getMonth()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the month-of-year field using the <code>Month</code> enum.
 <p>
 This method returns the enum <a href="Month.html" title="enum in java.time"><code>Month</code></a> for the month.
 This avoids confusion as to what <code>int</code> values mean.
 If you need access to the primitive <code>int</code> value then the enum
 provides the <a href="Month.html#getValue()"><code>int value</code></a>.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the month-of-year, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="seeLabel">See Also:</span></dt>
<dd><a href="#getMonthValue()"><code>getMonthValue()</code></a></dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getDayOfMonth()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getDayOfMonth</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;getDayOfMonth()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the day-of-month field.
 <p>
 This method returns the primitive <code>int</code> value for the day-of-month.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the day-of-month, from 1 to 31</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getDayOfYear()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getDayOfYear</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;getDayOfYear()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the day-of-year field.
 <p>
 This method returns the primitive <code>int</code> value for the day-of-year.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the day-of-year, from 1 to 365, or 366 in a leap year</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getDayOfWeek()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getDayOfWeek</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="DayOfWeek.html" title="enum in java.time">DayOfWeek</a>&nbsp;getDayOfWeek()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the day-of-week field, which is an enum <code>DayOfWeek</code>.
 <p>
 This method returns the enum <a href="DayOfWeek.html" title="enum in java.time"><code>DayOfWeek</code></a> for the day-of-week.
 This avoids confusion as to what <code>int</code> values mean.
 If you need access to the primitive <code>int</code> value then the enum
 provides the <a href="DayOfWeek.html#getValue()"><code>int value</code></a>.
 </p><p>
 Additional information can be obtained from the <code>DayOfWeek</code>.
 This includes textual names of the values.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the day-of-week, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="toLocalTime()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>toLocalTime</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="LocalTime.html" title="class in java.time">LocalTime</a>&nbsp;toLocalTime()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the <code>LocalTime</code> part of this date-time.
 <p>
 This returns a <code>LocalTime</code> with the same hour, minute, second and
 nanosecond as this date-time.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the time part of this date-time, not null</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getHour()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getHour</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;getHour()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the hour-of-day field.</div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the hour-of-day, from 0 to 23</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getMinute()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getMinute</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;getMinute()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the minute-of-hour field.</div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the minute-of-hour, from 0 to 59</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getSecond()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getSecond</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;getSecond()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the second-of-minute field.</div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the second-of-minute, from 0 to 59</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="getNano()">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>getNano</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;int&nbsp;getNano()</pre>
<div class="block">Gets the nano-of-second field.</div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>the nano-of-second, from 0 to 999,999,999</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="with(java.time.temporal.TemporalAdjuster)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>with</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;with&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalAdjuster.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAdjuster</a>&nbsp;adjuster)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns an adjusted copy of this date-time.
 <p>
 This returns an <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, based on this one, with the date-time adjusted.
 The adjustment takes place using the specified adjuster strategy object.
 Read the documentation of the adjuster to understand what adjustment will be made.
 </p><p>
 A simple adjuster might simply set the one of the fields, such as the year field.
 A more complex adjuster might set the date to the last day of the month.
 A selection of common adjustments is provided in
 <a href="temporal/TemporalAdjusters.html" title="class in java.time.temporal"><code>TemporalAdjusters</code></a>.
 These include finding the "last day of the month" and "next Wednesday".
 Key date-time classes also implement the <code>TemporalAdjuster</code> interface,
 such as <a href="Month.html" title="enum in java.time"><code>Month</code></a> and <a href="MonthDay.html" title="class in java.time"><code>MonthDay</code></a>.
 The adjuster is responsible for handling special cases, such as the varying
 lengths of month and leap years.
 </p><p>
 For example this code returns a date on the last day of July:
 <pre>
  import static java.time.Month.*;
  import static java.time.temporal.TemporalAdjusters.*;

  result = offsetDateTime.with(JULY).with(lastDayOfMonth());
 </pre>
 </p><p>
 The classes <a href="LocalDate.html" title="class in java.time"><code>LocalDate</code></a>, <a href="LocalTime.html" title="class in java.time"><code>LocalTime</code></a> and <a href="ZoneOffset.html" title="class in java.time"><code>ZoneOffset</code></a> implement
 <code>TemporalAdjuster</code>, thus this method can be used to change the date, time or offset:
 <pre>
  result = offsetDateTime.with(date);
  result = offsetDateTime.with(time);
  result = offsetDateTime.with(offset);
 </pre>
 </p><p>
 The result of this method is obtained by invoking the
 <a href="temporal/TemporalAdjuster.html#adjustInto(java.time.temporal.Temporal)"><code>TemporalAdjuster.adjustInto(Temporal)</code></a> method on the
 specified adjuster passing <code>this</code> as the argument.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html#with(java.time.temporal.TemporalAdjuster)">with</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">Temporal</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>adjuster</code> - the adjuster to use, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on <code>this</code> with the adjustment made, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the adjustment cannot be made</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../lang/ArithmeticException.html" title="class in java.lang">ArithmeticException</a></code> - if numeric overflow occurs</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="with(java.time.temporal.TemporalField,long)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>with</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;with&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalField.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalField</a>&nbsp;field,
                           long&nbsp;newValue)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this date-time with the specified field set to a new value.
 <p>
 This returns an <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, based on this one, with the value
 for the specified field changed.
 This can be used to change any supported field, such as the year, month or day-of-month.
 If it is not possible to set the value, because the field is not supported or for
 some other reason, an exception is thrown.
 </p><p>
 In some cases, changing the specified field can cause the resulting date-time to become invalid,
 such as changing the month from 31st January to February would make the day-of-month invalid.
 In cases like this, the field is responsible for resolving the date. Typically it will choose
 the previous valid date, which would be the last valid day of February in this example.
 </p><p>
 If the field is a <a href="temporal/ChronoField.html" title="enum in java.time.temporal"><code>ChronoField</code></a> then the adjustment is implemented here.
 </p><p>
 The <code>INSTANT_SECONDS</code> field will return a date-time with the specified instant.
 The offset and nano-of-second are unchanged.
 If the new instant value is outside the valid range then a <code>DateTimeException</code> will be thrown.
 </p><p>
 The <code>OFFSET_SECONDS</code> field will return a date-time with the specified offset.
 The local date-time is unaltered. If the new offset value is outside the valid range
 then a <code>DateTimeException</code> will be thrown.
 </p><p>
 The other <a href="#isSupported(java.time.temporal.TemporalField)"><code>supported fields</code></a> will behave as per
 the matching method on <a href="LocalDateTime.html#with(java.time.temporal.TemporalField,long)"><code>LocalDateTime</code></a>.
 In this case, the offset is not part of the calculation and will be unchanged.
 </p><p>
 All other <code>ChronoField</code> instances will throw an <code>UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</code>.
 </p><p>
 If the field is not a <code>ChronoField</code>, then the result of this method
 is obtained by invoking <code>TemporalField.adjustInto(Temporal, long)</code>
 passing <code>this</code> as the argument. In this case, the field determines
 whether and how to adjust the instant.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html#with(java.time.temporal.TemporalField,long)">with</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">Temporal</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>field</code> - the field to set in the result, not null</dd>
<dd><code>newValue</code> - the new value of the field in the result</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on <code>this</code> with the specified field set, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the field cannot be set</dd>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/UnsupportedTemporalTypeException.html" title="class in java.time.temporal">UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</a></code> - if the field is not supported</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../lang/ArithmeticException.html" title="class in java.lang">ArithmeticException</a></code> - if numeric overflow occurs</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="withYear(int)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withYear</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withYear&#8203;(int&nbsp;year)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the year altered.
 <p>
 The time and offset do not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 If the day-of-month is invalid for the year, it will be changed to the last valid day of the month.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>year</code> - the year to set in the result, from MIN_YEAR to MAX_YEAR</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the requested year, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the year value is invalid</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="withMonth(int)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withMonth</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withMonth&#8203;(int&nbsp;month)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the month-of-year altered.
 <p>
 The time and offset do not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 If the day-of-month is invalid for the year, it will be changed to the last valid day of the month.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>month</code> - the month-of-year to set in the result, from 1 (January) to 12 (December)</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the requested month, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the month-of-year value is invalid</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="withDayOfMonth(int)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withDayOfMonth</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withDayOfMonth&#8203;(int&nbsp;dayOfMonth)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the day-of-month altered.
 <p>
 If the resulting <code>OffsetDateTime</code> is invalid, an exception is thrown.
 The time and offset do not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>dayOfMonth</code> - the day-of-month to set in the result, from 1 to 28-31</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the requested day, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the day-of-month value is invalid,
  or if the day-of-month is invalid for the month-year</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="withDayOfYear(int)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withDayOfYear</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withDayOfYear&#8203;(int&nbsp;dayOfYear)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the day-of-year altered.
 <p>
 The time and offset do not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 If the resulting <code>OffsetDateTime</code> is invalid, an exception is thrown.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>dayOfYear</code> - the day-of-year to set in the result, from 1 to 365-366</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date with the requested day, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the day-of-year value is invalid,
  or if the day-of-year is invalid for the year</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="withHour(int)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withHour</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withHour&#8203;(int&nbsp;hour)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the hour-of-day altered.
 <p>
 The date and offset do not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>hour</code> - the hour-of-day to set in the result, from 0 to 23</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the requested hour, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the hour value is invalid</dd>
</dl>
</li>

<a id="withMinute(int)">

<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the minute-of-hour altered.
 <p>
 The date and offset do not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>

<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the minute value is invalid</dd>

<a id="withSecond(int)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withSecond</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withSecond&#8203;(int&nbsp;second)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the second-of-minute altered.
 <p>
 The date and offset do not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>

<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the second value is invalid</dd>
</dl>

</ul>
<a id="withNano(int)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>withNano</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;withNano&#8203;(int&nbsp;nanoOfSecond)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the nano-of-second altered.
 <p>
 The date and offset do not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>nanoOfSecond</code> - the nano-of-second to set in the result, from 0 to 999,999,999</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the requested nanosecond, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the nano value is invalid</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="truncatedTo(java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>truncatedTo</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;truncatedTo&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalUnit.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalUnit</a>&nbsp;unit)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the time truncated.
 <p>
 Truncation returns a copy of the original date-time with fields
 smaller than the specified unit set to zero.
 For example, truncating with the <a href="temporal/ChronoUnit.html#MINUTES"><code>minutes</code></a> unit
 will set the second-of-minute and nano-of-second field to zero.
 </p><p>
 The unit must have a <a href="temporal/TemporalUnit.html#getDuration()">duration</a>
 that divides into the length of a standard day without remainder.
 This includes all supplied time units on <a href="temporal/ChronoUnit.html" title="enum in java.time.temporal"><code>ChronoUnit</code></a> and
 <a href="temporal/ChronoUnit.html#DAYS"><code>DAYS</code></a>. Other units throw an exception.
 </p><p>
 The offset does not affect the calculation and will be the same in the result.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>unit</code> - the unit to truncate to, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the time truncated, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if unable to truncate</dd>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/UnsupportedTemporalTypeException.html" title="class in java.time.temporal">UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</a></code> - if the unit is not supported</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="plus(java.time.temporal.TemporalAmount)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>plus</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;plus&#8203;(<a href="temporal/TemporalAmount.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalAmount</a>&nbsp;amountToAdd)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this date-time with the specified amount added.
 <p>
 This returns an <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, based on this one, with the specified amount added.
 The amount is typically <a href="Period.html" title="class in java.time"><code>Period</code></a> or <a href="Duration.html" title="class in java.time"><code>Duration</code></a> but may be
 any other type implementing the <a href="temporal/TemporalAmount.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal"><code>TemporalAmount</code></a> interface.
 </p><p>
 The calculation is delegated to the amount object by calling
 <a href="temporal/TemporalAmount.html#addTo(java.time.temporal.Temporal)"><code>TemporalAmount.addTo(Temporal)</code></a>. The amount implementation is free
 to implement the addition in any way it wishes, however it typically
 calls back to <a href="#plus(long,java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)"><code>plus(long, TemporalUnit)</code></a>. Consult the documentation
 of the amount implementation to determine if it can be successfully added.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html#plus(java.time.temporal.TemporalAmount)">plus</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">Temporal</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>amountToAdd</code> - the amount to add, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the addition made, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the addition cannot be made</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../lang/ArithmeticException.html" title="class in java.lang">ArithmeticException</a></code> - if numeric overflow occurs</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="plus(long,java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>plus</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;plus&#8203;(long&nbsp;amountToAdd,
                           <a href="temporal/TemporalUnit.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">TemporalUnit</a>&nbsp;unit)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this date-time with the specified amount added.
 <p>
 This returns an <code>OffsetDateTime</code>, based on this one, with the amount
 in terms of the unit added. If it is not possible to add the amount, because the
 unit is not supported or for some other reason, an exception is thrown.
 </p><p>
 If the field is a <a href="temporal/ChronoUnit.html" title="enum in java.time.temporal"><code>ChronoUnit</code></a> then the addition is implemented by
 <a href="LocalDateTime.html#plus(long,java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)"><code>LocalDateTime.plus(long, TemporalUnit)</code></a>.
 The offset is not part of the calculation and will be unchanged in the result.
 </p><p>
 If the field is not a <code>ChronoUnit</code>, then the result of this method
 is obtained by invoking <code>TemporalUnit.addTo(Temporal, long)</code>
 passing <code>this</code> as the argument. In this case, the unit determines
 whether and how to perform the addition.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="overrideSpecifyLabel">Specified by:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html#plus(long,java.time.temporal.TemporalUnit)">plus</a></code>&nbsp;in interface&nbsp;<code><a href="temporal/Temporal.html" title="interface in java.time.temporal">Temporal</a></code></dd>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>amountToAdd</code> - the amount of the unit to add to the result, may be negative</dd>
<dd><code>unit</code> - the unit of the amount to add, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the specified amount added, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the addition cannot be made</dd>
<dd><code><a href="temporal/UnsupportedTemporalTypeException.html" title="class in java.time.temporal">UnsupportedTemporalTypeException</a></code> - if the unit is not supported</dd>
<dd><code><a href="../lang/ArithmeticException.html" title="class in java.lang">ArithmeticException</a></code> - if numeric overflow occurs</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="plusYears(long)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>plusYears</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;plusYears&#8203;(long&nbsp;years)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the specified number of years added.
 <p>
 This method adds the specified amount to the years field in three steps:
 <ol>
 <li>Add the input years to the year field</li>
 <li>Check if the resulting date would be invalid</li>
 <li>Adjust the day-of-month to the last valid day if necessary</li>
 </ol>
 </p><p>
 For example, 2008-02-29 (leap year) plus one year would result in the
 invalid date 2009-02-29 (standard year). Instead of returning an invalid
 result, the last valid day of the month, 2009-02-28, is selected instead.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>years</code> - the years to add, may be negative</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the years added, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the result exceeds the supported date range</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="plusMonths(long)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>plusMonths</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;plusMonths&#8203;(long&nbsp;months)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the specified number of months added.
 <p>
 This method adds the specified amount to the months field in three steps:
 <ol>
 <li>Add the input months to the month-of-year field</li>
 <li>Check if the resulting date would be invalid</li>
 <li>Adjust the day-of-month to the last valid day if necessary</li>
 </ol>
 </p><p>
 For example, 2007-03-31 plus one month would result in the invalid date
 2007-04-31. Instead of returning an invalid result, the last valid day
 of the month, 2007-04-30, is selected instead.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>months</code> - the months to add, may be negative</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the months added, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the result exceeds the supported date range</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="plusWeeks(long)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>plusWeeks</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;plusWeeks&#8203;(long&nbsp;weeks)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this OffsetDateTime with the specified number of weeks added.
 <p>
 This method adds the specified amount in weeks to the days field incrementing
 the month and year fields as necessary to ensure the result remains valid.
 The result is only invalid if the maximum/minimum year is exceeded.
 </p><p>
 For example, 2008-12-31 plus one week would result in 2009-01-07.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>weeks</code> - the weeks to add, may be negative</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the weeks added, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the result exceeds the supported date range</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>
<a id="plusDays(long)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>plusDays</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;plusDays&#8203;(long&nbsp;days)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this OffsetDateTime with the specified number of days added.
 <p>
 This method adds the specified amount to the days field incrementing the
 month and year fields as necessary to ensure the result remains valid.
 The result is only invalid if the maximum/minimum year is exceeded.
 </p><p>
 For example, 2008-12-31 plus one day would result in 2009-01-01.
 </p><p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
<dt><span class="paramLabel">Parameters:</span></dt>
<dd><code>days</code> - the days to add, may be negative</dd>
<dt><span class="returnLabel">Returns:</span></dt>
<dd>an <code>OffsetDateTime</code> based on this date-time with the days added, not null</dd>
<dt><span class="throwsLabel">Throws:</span></dt>
<dd><code><a href="DateTimeException.html" title="class in java.time">DateTimeException</a></code> - if the result exceeds the supported date range</dd>
</dl>
</li>
</ul>

 <p>

<a id="plusSeconds(long)">

<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>plusSeconds</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;plusSeconds&#8203;(long&nbsp;seconds)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the specified number of seconds added.
 <p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>

<a id="plusNanos(long)">
<!--   -->
</a>
<ul class="blockList">
<li class="blockList">
<h4>plusNanos</h4>
<pre class="methodSignature">public&nbsp;<a href="OffsetDateTime.html" title="class in java.time">OffsetDateTime</a>&nbsp;plusNanos&#8203;(long&nbsp;nanos)</pre>
<div class="block">Returns a copy of this <code>OffsetDateTime</code> with the specified number of nanoseconds added.
 <p>
 This instance is immutable and unaffected by this method call.</p></div>
<dl>
